resources.name: Daily 8-hour ozone averages for sites in the Midwest

organization.description: The National Institute for Applied Statistics Research Australia (NIASRA) is a research institute based at the University of Wollongong, Australia. It aims to identify Australia as a place where the discipline of applied statistics collaborates with academics and professionals in science, government, business and industry to tackle strategic problems. More information on NIASRA can be found at http://niasra.uow.edu.au/what-is-niasra/index.html
organization.title: NIASRA
organization.name: niasra

name: daily-8-hour-ozone-averages-for-sites-in-the-midwest
notes:
Description
--------------

This dataset was taken from the package 'fields' and put into table format. The description in the package is as follows:

The response is 8-hour average (surface) ozone ( from 9AM-4PM) measured in parts per billion (PPB) for 153 sites in the midwestern US over the period June 3,1987 through August 31, 1987, 89 days. This season of high ozone corresponds with a large modeling experiment using the EPA Regional Oxidant Model.

Format
--------------

The csv file has 153 rows (one per site) and 92 fields. 

- lon: longitude coordinate of site

- lat: latitude coordinate of site

- station id: unique identifier of station

- the other 89 columns are the ozone readings on the different days (column names are in year/month/day format). 

Reference
--------------

Nychka, D., Cox, L., Piegorsch, W. (1998) Case Studies in Environmental Statistics Lecture Notes in Statistics, Springer Verlag, New York
title: Daily 8-hour ozone averages for sites in the Midwest
